page.title: 14RECREATION IN OLD BUCKENHAM
page.content: The schools offer some facilities, including evening classes at the High School, where there is also an outdoor swimming pool. Both schools have their own parents' associations for fund-raising and social events. There is an Air Training Corps, plus Scouts, Guides and Brownies. The political parties run fund-raising and social activities for members and guests. There are two pubs, one of which runs discos and folk nights and the other gives a Christmas dinner to the old people. The main event involving all the village is the summer fete held on the first Saturday in August. Village groups can have their own stall. Sports are well represented in the village, with teams for Football, Cricket, Rugby and Womens' Hockey.
